award_title: CAREER: Multi-physical and Multi-scale Testing and  Modeling of Water Infiltration through Frozen Soils
subject: code that outlives the paper
body:
Hey Jongwan,

I'm a computational materials scientist who keeps running into the same problem: models and simulations that work great for a paper basically evaporate after publication.

Built something called Ouro to fix thisâ€”it's infrastructure that turns published computational methods into things other researchers can actually call and reuse without reverse-engineering your code.

Figured this might resonate if you've done any modeling work on frozen soil dynamics. Happy to share more if you're curious.

Hope you're having a good holiday season.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
